description:
This canyon is to be avoided, as it has more Poison Oak than the author has seen anywhere else in his entire life. There are a half-dozen rappels and no anchor challenges. The final three rappels are rather fun, but it's not worth it.

Approach

From the parking lot on the north side of the West Fork bridge, hike up the obvious ridge leading NW from the lot. Take that up for half a mile and a little under a thousand feet of gain and drop into the canyon on the right, if you must.

Descent

Bushwhacking through endless Poison Oak. A couple alright sections, but mostly bad bushwhacking and crummy rappels.

Exit

Hike back south to the parking lot.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

  • First Descent TR

Background
name: Poison Canyon
